'''Aenalys''' is a character in {{poe2}}. 

## Background

{{Description|A young woman reclines on the cushions, a hookah hose held delicately in one hand. Eyes closed, she sings to herself. Her voice is soft and inviting.

She doesn't move when she hears you approach, but slowly opens her eyes with a lazy smile.}}

Aenalys is a professional actor who belonged to a troupe that toured the [Aedyr Empire](/aedyrEmpire/). Performing classic works of literature to cheering audience and enjoying good wages amounted to a decent life when things were going well. However, she desired a more dependable audience and so picked up the trade of a courtesan.

## Interactions

{{Interactions
|companion       =
|wares           =
|stronghold      =
|rest            =
|quests_started  =
|quests_involved = [Lost Dues in Good Faith](/lostDuesInGoodFaith/)
|none            = 
|other           = * Bringing [Aloth](/aloth/) along results in an unique interaction during the quest.
* For {{cp2|100}} you can hire her services, listen to poetry, and receive Aenalys' Boon (+1 [Explosives](/explosives/) and [Metaphysics](/metaphysics/), +2 [Perception](/perception/))
* She occasionally stands up and walks over to her cabinet, giving you a good opportunity to pickpocket the [key](/aenalysKey/) from her.
}}

## Quests

* [Lost Dues in Good Faith](/lostDuesInGoodFaith/): [Oswald](/oswald/) favoured her, and he often visited to listen to old epics in Eld Aedyran.
[Category:Queen's Berth characters](/categoryQueensBerthCharacters/)
[Category:The Wild Mare characters](/categoryTheWildMareCharacters/)

'''Aenalys''' is a character in {{poe2}}. 

==Background==
{{Description|A young woman reclines on the cushions, a hookah hose held delicately in one hand. Eyes closed, she sings to herself. Her voice is soft and inviting.

She doesn't move when she hears you approach, but slowly opens her eyes with a lazy smile.}}

Aenalys is a professional actor who belonged to a troupe that toured the [[Aedyr Empire]]. Performing classic works of literature to cheering audience and enjoying good wages amounted to a decent life when things were going well. However, she desired a more dependable audience and so picked up the trade of a courtesan.

==Interactions==
{{Interactions
